meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring time, consisting of two glass bulbs connected by a narrow neck and containing sand that takes a specified amount of time to flow from the upper bulb to the lower one.
meanings.sent1: I watched the sandglasses on my teacher's desk to know when class would end.
meanings.sent2: The sandglasses in the museum were beautifully crafted and mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a giant sandglasses to predict when his trick would end.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped away like sand through a sandglasses, leaving only memories behind.
meanings.sent5: The sandglasses in the old library seemed to whisper secrets of the past as the sand trickled down.

meanings.definition: A device used to indicate the passage of time by the flow of sand through a small hole.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's antique sandglasses was a cherished family heirloom.
meanings.sent2: The sandglasses on the shelf served as a reminder of the importance of time management.
meanings.sent3: The sandglasses at the beach party added a whimsical touch to the decorations.
meanings.sent4: As the sandglasses emptied, it signaled the end of the game with a soft chime.
meanings.sent5: The sandglasses in the classroom seemed to slow down time as the students eagerly awaited the bell.
